text:
MOST APPROPRIATE EXPRESSION AND INTERPRETATION

It is necessary for you to understand idiomatic expressions, prepositions and phrasal verbs discussed earlier before reading this chapter. You can also go through the glossary for meaning of some words. It comes out in UNN PUTME almost every year, so take your time and master the PUTME and JAMB examples. They are not hard to learn.

 

PUME UNN 2005/2006

1. You are driving too fast for safety.

A. That speed is all right and safe. B. That speed is not fast enough for safety. C. That speed is not entirely safe. D. You should drive faster to ensure safety. 

(C. That speed is not entirely safe)

 

2. For all I care, the man may be dead.

A. I am not sure that the man is dead. B. I am not interested in his death. C. I very much care in case he is dead. D. I am ignorant of the man’s death. 

(B. I am not interested in his death).

 

PUTME 2008/2009

3. Posters have been printed, and would be distributed to the rank and file.

A. to both the ordinary members and the leaders. B. to those of high ranks and file. C. to the leaders alone. D. to the ordinary members alone.

(D. to the ordinary members alone).

 

PUME UNN 2009/2010

4.With the screening test around the corner, I've got the jitters already.

A. I've felt confident. B. I've felt secured and hopeful. C. I’m getting anxious. D. I’m getting afraid

(B. I’m getting afraid).

 

5. The teacher warned her students against resting on them

A. relaxing on soft chairs. B. taking things for granted. C. depending on past achievements. D. feeling satisfied and making no new efforts

(D. feeling satisfied and making no new efforts). 

 

6. We were asked to ______ the matter, and to give our reply the following day.

A. sleep over. B. sleep on. C. sleep through. D. sleep with

(B. Sleep on. Sleep over means to stay the night at somebody else home. Sleep on something means to delay making a decision about it until the next day, so that you have time to think about it). 

 

PUME UNN 2013/2014

7. I have my assignments ______.

A. in my hand. B. on my hands. C. on my hand. D. in my hands

(B. on my hands).

 

8. We have been warned to mind how we talk to her because she is easily

A. heated up. B. set up. C. hot up. D. het up

(D. Het up as applied in the sentence is an adjective which describes someone who is anxious, excited or slightly angry).

 

9. During the harmattan, we often shut the doors and windows in order to keep the cold ______.

A. out. B. off. C. down. D. away

(A. Out).

 

10. Having failed this examination on two occasions, I decided _____ advice to help me improve on my performance.

A. to seek of. B. to seek for. C. to seek. D. to ask of

(C. To seek). 

 

11. Tom ought not to have told me.

A. Tom did not tell me but he should. B. Perhaps Torn was wrong to have told me. C. Tom told me but it was wrong of him. D. It was necessary for Tom not to tell me

(C. Tom told me but it was wrong of him). 

 

12. Do you mind my smoking here? No, I don't mind

A. You can smoke here. B. No, you can smoke outside. C. No, you cannot smoke here. D. You can smoke anywhere

(It’s a negative statement in structure. The question, “Do you mind my smoking, here?” Can be said to mean “Do you object/dislike me to smoke here?” ' The answer, “No, I don’t mind.” means you can smoke here)

 

PUME UNN 2014/2015

13. He ______ the generator immediately the light was restored.

A. off. B. switched off. C. put out. D. put off

(B. switched off)

 

14. Emeka _____his father.

A. took after. B. took on. C. took to. D. took up

(A. took after).

 

15. Now that the examination is fast approaching, the teachers have been instructed to _____their lessons.

A. round over. B. round up. C. round off. D. round in

(C. round off).

 

PUME UNN 2014/2015 (II)

16. After the strike the traders .... the prices of their goods,

A. beat up. B. beat down. C. beat on. D. beat off

(B. beat down)

 

17. The judge ____ the decision of the lower court.

A. held up. B. abolished. C. upheld. D. reversed

(Upheld, I.e to agree that a former agreement was correct).

 

18. It is usually hard to change the course of action when one crosses the Rubicon. The underlined expression, as used in this sentence, means to.

A. pass through a place called Rubicon. B. cross a river called Rubicon. C. cross a bridge called Rubicon

D. be irrevocably committed

(be irrevocably committed). 

 

19. "It is irrational for one to count one's chickens before the eggs hatched."

A. The eggs are not to be broken. B. Not everything works out as outlined. C. One should not regard one's eggs as chickens. D. It is senseless to hatch one's eggs prematurely

(Not everything works out as outlined).

 

PUME UNN 2017/2018

20. After the initial confusion, the Manager's suggestion brought _____ to the depressed investors.

A. a glitter of hope. B. a sparkle of hope. C. a raise of hope. D. a glimmer of hope

(a glimmer of hope).

 

21. The body is sensitive to changes in velocity which, if too sudden, ______.

A. it may lose consciousness. B. consciousness may be lost. C. one may become unconscious. D. may cause loss of consciousness

(may cause loss of consciousness).

 

22. After a careful review of Adamu’s last examination result, the principal concluded that his performance left much to be desired. 

A. was extremely desirable. B. was very brilliant. C. was very unsatisfactory. D. was very satisfactory

(was very unsatisfactory).

 

23. The take home pay of many workers is such that they can hardly make both ends meet.

A. finish their schedule of work. B. live an honest life. C. keep two jobs at a time. D. live within their income

(live an honest life).

 

24. "To put something aside” is to

A. keeps in safety. B. keep something for some special purpose. C. put it in a side pocket for future use. D. put it by one's side

(keep something for some special purpose).

 

25. "An open secret" means

A. an open matter. B. a fact that is very secret. C. a secret known to everybody. D. a confidential matter

(a secret known to everybody).

 

JAMB EXPECTED QUESTIONS

Section 1

26. When asked to state her side of the story, Bunmi started by beating about the bush. This means that Bunmi

A. went straight to the point. B. was lost in great thought. C. followed a bush path. D. approached the subject without coming to the point.

(approached the subject without coming to the point).

 

27. The amount he donated was small. He said it was his widow's mite. This means that

A. he was a widow. B. he was misery. C. it was all he could honestly afford. D. he could have given more.

(it was all he could honestly afford)

 

28. The friendship between Segun and Shehu has turned sour. This means that Segun and Shehu are

A. no longer friends. B. stilt friends. C. better friends now. D. getting to understand each other.

(no longer friends)

 

29. The driver smelled a rat when the policemen asked him to stop. ] It means that the driver was

A. reckless. B. auspicious. C. careful. D. offensive.

(auspicious)

 

30. The students were as Wised to face their studies and let the sleeping dog lie. This means that the students shout 

A. obey the authorities. B. organise them properly. C. leave matters as they are now. D. be as watchful as sleeping dogs.

(leave matters as they are now)

 

31. From the way Ngozi behaves, it is obvious she is a greenhorn. "This means that Ngozi is 

A. arrogant. B. cautious. C. inexperienced. D. uncivilised. 

(inexperienced)

 

32. The economic situation is so bad that many wage earners are hardly able to make both ends meet. This means that

A. people's income exceed their expenditure. B. most people are extravagant with their income. C. people's earnings are not sufficient for their essential needs. D. most people engage in activities that bring them extra pay.

(people's earnings are not sufficient for their essential needs)

 

33. Since I found out his hypocritical nature, I have been keeping him at arm's length. This mean: that I ___

A. avoid being similar with him. B. ignore his advice. C. report him to the authority. D). stop visiting him.

(avoid being similar with him).

 

34. I knew Okoronkwo's father very well and I must say that his son is a chip off the old block. Thy means that Okoronkwo

A. has Chosen the game career as its father. B. is very much like his father. C. is a I extremely different sort of person from his lather. D. has taken up a different profession from his father's.

(is very much like his father)

 

35. The debating team was warned to make convincing points and not to play to the gallery. This means that the team should not

A. be selfish. B. underrate opponents. C. be over-confident. D. attempt to win cheap popularity.

(attempt to win cheap popularity)

 

36. Anyone who thinks that he can succeed in life without working hard is living in a fool's paradise. This means is that such a person

A. is having an illusion. B. thinks other people are fools. C. thinks hat working is merely a joke. D. is on the verge of insanity.

(is having an illusion)

 

37. The government didn't mind my mentioning his name

(a) He was not angry when I mentioned his name (b) He was angry when I mentioned his name (c) He told me not to mention his name (d) He forgot to mention his name to me

(He was not angry when I mentioned his name)

 

38. The leader said he was not unaware of the plight of the people

(a) He knew of their plight (b) He was not informed of their plight (c) He could not understand their plight (d) He felt their plight

(He felt their plight)

 

Section 2

39. But for the expense, I'd buy bigger car

(a) I want to buy a bigger car because it is more expensive (b) I will not buy bigger car because it is too expensive (c) I would buy a bigger car if I had more money (d) I would like to buy a bigger car if it was not so expensive

(I will not buy bigger car because it is too expensive)

 

40. No sooner had he got into the pool than the telephone rang

(a) He didn't get into the pool because the telephone rang (b) The telephone rang just after he got into the pool (c) The telephone rang as he was getting into the pool (d) The telephone rang before he got into the pool

(The telephone rang just after he got into the pool)

 

41. My father said I might just as well stay at home for another year

(a) I should stay at home because I had no other choice (b) I might stay at home and do well (c) Staying at home was probably the best thing for me (d) I ought to stay at home in order to do well

(I ought to stay at home in order to do well)

 

42. Ramatu expressed her feelings in no uncertain terms (a) she expressed it feebly and sickly (b) she expresses it quietly and cautiously (c) she expressed it secretly and courageously (d) she expressed it clearly and strongly

(she expressed it clearly and strongly, Note that no + negative statement = positive statement)

 

43. Zinana's examination result was not unfavourable (a) She failed her examination (b) Her result could not earn her admission (c) She was successful in the examination. 

(She was successful in the examination, Note that no + negative statement = positive statement)


44. Usman needs to get his act together if he wants to pass the examination (a) he needs to put on his stage costume (b) he needs to be fast when writing the examination (c) he needs to organise himself (d) he needs to put all points down in the examination

(he needs to organise himself)

 

45. As the drama unfolded, Olatinuke was advised to keep her shirt on (a) she was advised to stay calm (b) she was advised to commit herself (c) she was advised to join the club (d) she was advised to wear her shirt

(she was advised to stay calm)



46. The team's poor performance at the tournament plumbed the depths of horror.
(a) the team's performance was rewarded (b) the team's performance took them to the next round (c) the team's performance was enjoyed by all (d) the team's performance was full of disappointment
(the team's performance was full of disappointment)
 

47. He is a clinging child (a) He is a bully (b) He likes to cling with his sister (c) He is possessive (d) He is a handsome young man
(He is possessive)


48. You need to brush up on your Spanish (a) you need a brush from Spain (b) you need to study the history of Spain (c) you need to learn to play with a Spaniard (d) you need to improve your skills.

(you need to improve your skills). 

 

49. 'I can't wait to become a mother.' the new bride declared (a) she sees motherhood as a burden (b) she will be patient as a mother (c) She is not keen on becoming a mother (d) she is excited about motherhood.
(she is excited about motherhood)


50. Amaka would pass for beauty queen (a) she was acting as a beauty queen (b) she would pass the drink to the queen who is sitting next to her (c) she would be accepted by all as a beauty queen (d) she walked past the beauty queen
(she would be accepted by all as a beauty queen)

 

51. The lecture is Uye’s road to Damascus.
A. The lecture is an opportunity to travel to Damascus. B. The lecture is an experience that changes the way she thinks. C. The lecture talks exclusively about Damascus. D. The lecture is an experience that cannot be changed.
(The lecture is an experience that changes the way she thinks)


52. Ado is one of the backwoodsmen.
A. He is one of those that live in a distant and underdeveloped area. B. He is one of the active members of the community. C. He is one of the honest men that lives in the community. D. He is one of those that live in the most developed part of the city
(He is one of those that live in a distant and underdeveloped area)


Section 3

53. Bello said he would pitch his tent with the club.
A. He would support the club. B. He would build a pitch in the club. C. He would build a tent on the pitch. D. He would distance himself from the club.

(He would support the club)

 

54. Try not to lose heart, said the man.
A. Try not to be bold and weak. B. Try not to become sad and hopeless. C. Try not to be happy and feeble. D. Try not to be timid and hopeful.

(Try not to become sad and hopeless)



55. Kasim would have attended the party if he had been invited.
A. He would not have attended even if he eat. B. He attended the party before he was invited. C. He was not invited and so, he did not attend. D. He attended the party without invitation.

(He was not invited and so, he did not attend)

 

56. Tolu and Chinedu live in each other’s pockets.
A. They are long-term business partners. B. They steal from each other. C. They blackmail each other. D. They are very close to each other.

(They are very close to each other)


57. The team’s poor performance at the tournament plumb the depths of horror.
A. The team’s performance took them to the next round. B. The team’s performance was enjoyed by all. C. The team’s performance was full of disappointment. D. The team’s performance was rewarded.
(The team’s performance was full of disappointment)

58. Hardworking students must not have a finger in very pie at school.
(a) Hardworking students must not have a role to play in most activities in the school
(b) Only hardworking students must participate in all activities in the school
(c) Hardworking students do not participate in all activities in the school
(d) Hardworking students must ask others to participate in school activities.

(Hardworking students do not participate in all activities in the school)

 

59. The vice chancellor is riding the crest of the last quarter of his administration.
(a) The vice chancellor enjoys the acknowledgement of the success of his administration
(b) The vice chancellor does not enjoy the people’s criticism of his administration
(c) The vice chancellor hopes to overcome soon, the poor comments on his administration
(d) The vice chancellor does not talk of his successes on office
(The vice chancellor enjoys the acknowledgement of the success of his administration)
 

60. She was absolved by the course from the charge.
(a) She was convicted for the charge. (b) She was blamed and charged to court. (c) Her case was resolved by the court. (d) She was declared free from the charge
(She was declared free from the charge)


61. The landlord is fond of throwing his weight about
(a) The landlord likes healthy exercise. (b) The landlord is overweight, (c) The landlord gives orders to people. (d) The landlord is respected by his tenants
(The landlord gives orders to people)
 

62. The company ought to have issued warrants for one billion shares.
(a) The company has issued one billion shares. (b)The management expected the company to issue more than one billion shares. (c) Members of the company bought less than one billion shares. (d) The company did not issue one billion shares
(The company did not issue one billion shares)


63. He needed not to have played in the position of quarterback in the volley ball.
(a) He participated in the game in his unusual position
(b)Nobody expected him to have participated in the game
(c) He wanted to play in a position other than the one he was offered.
(d) Someone did not want him to play in the position that he played
(He participated in the game in his unusual position)


64. I wouldn’t have responded to his rude talk, if I were you.
(a) The advice was taken by the respondent, so he did not respond to the talk
(b) The adviser put himself in the respondent’s position, so he did not respond to the talk
(c) The respondent replied to the speaker’s talk, although he ought not have done so
(d) What was advisable was that the respondent gave it back to the speaker
(The respondent replied to the speaker’s talk, although he ought not have done so)


65. He could not speak out because he had a foot of clay.
(a) His feet was muddy. (b) He was weak and cowardly. (c) He was clumsy and lazy. (d) He was shy and timid
(He was shy and timid)

66. The player wasted a golden opportunity during the penalty shoot-out.
(a) The player first the bar. (b) The player did not score the shot. (c) The player scored the shot that made them win the gold cup. (d) Instead of a silver cup, they received the golden one
(The player did not score the shot)


67. As far as Abu is concerned, Mero should be given fifty naira at the most
(a) All Abu is saying is that Mero probably deserves more than fifty naira and not less
(b) All Abu is concerned with is that Mero should be given nothing more than fifty naira
(c) In Abu’s estimation, Mero merits not more than fifty naira
(d) In Abu’s opinion, Mero deserves fifty naira or probably more

(All Abu is concerned with is that Mero should be given nothing more than fifty naira)

 

Section 4

68. The secretary said that the postponement of the meeting was due to unforeseen circumstances.
(a) The date of the meeting was shifted as a result of unexpected reasons.
(b) The meeting’s date was put off for strange reasons.
(c) The meeting was called off as a result of obstacles hitherto unknown.
(d) The meeting broke off as a result of unusual difficulties.
(The date of the meeting was shifted as a result of unexpected reasons)
 

69. The hunter has a bird’s-eye view of the animals.
(a) He views the animal from a high position. (b) He views the bird’s eye. (c) He views the birds on the tree with one eye. (d) He watches animals and birds closely.
(He views the animal from a high position)

 

70. She stopped her education as her uncle left her in the lurch.
(a) Her uncle deceived her. (b) Her uncle disinherited her. (c) Her uncle refused to help her
(d) Her uncle disrespected her

(Her uncle refused to help her)



71. The plan to upgrade the dispensary to a general hospital did not materialize.
(a) The plan did not meet the required specifications. (b) The arrangement did not work out as wished. (c) It was difficult to obtained the materials. (d) The materials purchased ware not the right ones.
(The arrangement did not work out as wished)


72. Okon’s company took a hit last year.
(a) His company improved last year. (b) His company made a huge success last year
(c) His company was badly damaged last year. (d) His company was established last year
(His company made a huge success last year)

 

73. Though Mr. Iro is a new chairman, he views other members with jaundiced eye.
A. He takes a rather forceful position on dealing with his members
B. He takes an unfavourable position concerning his members
C. He takes a sickly view of his members
D. He takes a rather hazy view of his members

(He takes an unfavourable position concerning his members)

 

74. It was good to steer a middle course in whatever one does.
A. It is always good to get midway in anything one does
B. It is always good to act with moderation
C. It is always good to move away from the forefront
D. It is always good to work very hard.
(It is always good to act with moderation)


75. The witness said he had no axe to grind with his brothers
A. He had no hatred for the brothers
B. He had no axe and therefore stole the matchet
C. He had no axe and therefore borrowed their matchet
D. He had no vested interest in the brothers
(He had no hatred for the brothers)


76. The footballers moved with their tails between their legs.
A. they moved happily because they won the match
B. they were unhappy because they had been despised by their opponents
C. they were ashamed because they had been defeated
D. they moved with their tails between their legs.
(they were ashamed because they had been defeated)


77. The headmaster managed to talk his way out of having to give a speech
A. he delivered a speech despite the difficulty
B. he managed to give a speech out of a difficult situation
C. he managed to get himself out of a difficult situation
D. he managed to talk on his way.
(he managed to get himself out of a difficult situation)


78. As regards the matter, we have crossed the rubicon
A. we are completely at a loss
B. we are irrevocably committed
C. we are already qualified
D. we are perfectly committed
(we are irrevocably committed)


79. Uche is full of himself
A. He is conceited B. He is complete C. He is a rich man D. He is careful.
(He is conceited)


80. As debutants in that tournament, the Super Eagles were up against their first opponents by three goals to nill
A. The Super Eagles were playing in the tournament for the first time, but they won their match by three goals to nothing
B. Though the Super Eagles were rated as the weakest side in the tournament, they won their first match by three goals to nill
C. Even though the Super Eagles were playing without some of their regulars, they won their match by three goals to nill.
D. As the best attackers in the match, the Super Eagles easily defeated their opponents by three goals to nothing.
(The Super Eagles were playing in the tournament for the first time, but they won their match by three goals to nothing)


81. The woman was mournful as her husband was found dead drunk
A. She was sad because of her husband was absolutely drunk
B. She was apprehensive that her husband would drink again as soon he recovered from
the drunken stupor
C. She was sad because her husband was drunk and always as helpless as a dead man
D. She was mourning because her husband drank and died
(She was sad because her husband was drunk and always as helpless as a dead man)
